title: 105_hr4046
content: Restrictions on transfers or discharges of nursing facility residents in case of voluntary withdrawal from Medicaid program. In case of voluntary withdrawal from Medicaid program, nursing facility residents have restrictions on transfers or discharges. Amendments to the Social Security Act allow nursing facilities to maintain rights if they withdraw from participation but continue providing services. Residents of a nursing facility cannot be transferred or discharged based solely on the facility's voluntary withdrawal from Medicaid participation. The provisions of the Social Security Act still apply to these residents until they are discharged from the facility. Residents of a nursing facility cannot be transferred or discharged solely due to the facility's withdrawal from Medicaid. For new residents after the withdrawal, the facility must orally and in writing provide information and obtain acknowledgment. The nursing facility must obtain a written acknowledgment from each individual regarding the information provided, separate from other signed documents. This does not affect the requirement for advance notice to the State or the Secretary in a participation agreement. The nursing facility must provide advance notice to the State or the Secretary before terminating the agreement. Information for new residents includes the facility's non-participation in the program and the possibility of transfer or discharge. The nursing facility can discharge a resident if they are unable to pay, even if they become eligible for medical assistance. Residents described in clause (i)(I) can continue to receive payments and maintain compliance with the State plan for nursing facility services even after the facility voluntarily withdraws from participation. Residents described in clause (i)(I) can continue to receive payments and maintain compliance with the State plan for nursing facility services even after the facility voluntarily withdraws from participation, including applying survey, certification, and enforcement authority. The provisions apply to significant voluntary reductions in participation under a State plan for residents entitled to medical assistance for nursing facility services. The provisions apply to significant voluntary reductions in participation under a State plan for residents entitled to medical assistance for nursing facility services. This paragraph does not apply to new residents who begin residence in a facility after the effective date of the withdrawal from participation. The provisions apply to voluntary withdrawals from participation in nursing facilities under a State plan for residents entitled to medical assistance. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must submit a report to Congress on the impact of the implementation of the amendment within 5 years of the enactment of this Act. The Secretary must submit a report to Congress within 5 years of the enactment of the Act. The report will analyze the impact of changes in Medicaid reimbursement rates for nursing facility services on participation in the Medicaid program and make recommendations for legislative changes.
